pullRequest.title: [RW-2178][RISK=NO]Warning for short research purpose review
pullRequest.bodyText:
The text inside any of the Research summary (Question 2.1 ,2.2 and 2.3 ) will be restricted to max of 1000 characters. The user WILL NOT be able to enter anything if has reached its limit. The following message will be displayed "You have reached the character limit for this question"



If the researcher has entered more than 950 characters, the message characters remaining will turn red



If the number of characters is less than 50 and user moves away from text, a warning text in red color will be displayed "The description you entered seems too short. Please consider adding more descriptive details to help the Program and your fellow Researchers understand your work." this will go away once the user types in more than 50 characters.



PR checklist

 This PR meets the Acceptance Criteria in the JIRA story
 The JIRA story has been moved to Dev Review
 This PR includes appropriate unit tests
 I have run and tested this change locally
 If this includes an API change, I have updated the appropriate Swagger definitions and notified API consumers
 If this includes a new feature flag, I have created and linked new JIRA tickets to (a) turn on the feature flag and (b) remove it later

commit.message: Warning message if research summary is < 50 char

nodes.bodyText: I would explicitly say 50-1000 characters if we're blocking on < 50.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -158,7 +158,7 @@ export const researchPurposeQuestions = [ description:
If you are exploring the data at this stage to formalize a specific research question, please describe the reason for exploring the data, and the scientific question you hope to be able to answer using the data.
- (Free text; 500 Character limit)
+ (Free text; 1000 Character limit)

nodes.bodyText: nit: 'at least' instead of 'atleast'
nit: just write out the entire words of 'characterMessage'
I wouldn't call these props if they're part of state.

         showUnderservedPopulationDetails: false,
         showStigmatizationDetails: false,

-        showCreateBillingAccountModal: false

nodes.bodyText: nit: 'atleast' -> 'at least'
nit: 'atleast' -> 'at least'
nit: 'atleast' -> 'at least'
Don't delete text the user has entered. Just prevent them from submitting it until it's a short enough text.
Why 950?
This won't make the message go away, right? It'll just turn it grey.

commit.message: PR Comment atleast -> at least and change variable name change to State rather than Props
had a chat with Karthik removing the blocking which includes red border and disable submit button if char is <50
some label and id name change as per PR suggestion

nodes.bodyText: It's not a good experience for the user. If you have to cut down text to size you want to be able to see what you would have written if you'd had as many words as you want, so you can summarize.
Can you please change this to warningMessage? No need to abbreviate this
If researchValue is a prop it shouldn't be changing. This should be a full React.Component with props and state, and anything that has the ability to change should be in state.

commit.message: move Components to util file and create React class for workspce researchpurposesummary

nodes.bodyText: Moved WorkspaceEditSection along with WorkspaceResearchSummary object to another file since there is already a lot going on in workspace-edit file.

nodes.bodyText: It seems like this should be in its own file, consumed by both WorkspaceResearchSummary and workspace-edit.tsx. That avoids having to name files things like workspace-util-component - you can name one file workspace-edit-section and the other workspace-research-summary.
